com.googlecode.transmuter
Class Transmuter

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.transmuter.Transmuter

public class Transmuter
extends Object

The main object in the library. A transmuter provides a centralized type conversion operation, using previously registered methods as converters. Objects containing converter methods (public methods marked with the Converts annotation) may register them in the transmuter. These methods may later be used as converters when a conversion operation is made with matching types.

There cannot be more than one registered converter with the exact same type; the existing one must be explicitly unregistered before the new one is included.

Author:
Humberto S. N. dos Anjos

Method Detail

convert

public <From,To> To convert(From from,
                            Class<To> toType)
Performs a conversion, taking from and generating a new object of type toType.

Type Parameters:
From - the input type of the conversion.
To - the output type of the conversion.
Parameters:
from - the object to convert.
toType - the type of the converted object.
Returns:
an instance of toType.
Throws:
NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException - if no converters for from's type to toType were found.
TooManyConvertersFoundException - if more than one converter for from's type to toType was found.
IllegalArgumentException - if from or toType is null (or void for toType).
BindingInvocationException - if there was an error during the converter's invocation.

public <From,To,SubFrom extends From> To convert(SubFrom from,
                                                 Class<From> fromType,
                                                 Class<To> toType)
Performs a conversion, taking from (which is considered to be of type fromType for the purposes of this operation) and generating a new object of type toType.

Type Parameters:
From - the input type of the conversion.
To - the output type of the conversion.
SubFrom - the actual type of the object to convert. Used only to ensure that from is a subtype of fromType.
Parameters:
from - the object to convert.
fromType - the type of the object to convert.
toType - the type of the converted object.
Returns:
an instance of toType.

TooManyConvertersFoundException - if more than one converter for fromType to toType was found.
IllegalArgumentException - if fromType or toType is null or void.
BindingInvocationException - if there was an error during the converter's invocation.

convertRaw

protected Object convertRaw(Object from,
                            TypeToken<?> toType)
Performs a conversion, taking from and generating a new object of type toType. This method doesn't use generics for compile-time checking, returning the result as a raw Object. So, due to erasure-imposed limitations, from's runtime class will be considered as the input type. For example, this means that both invocations below: 
 convertRaw(new ArrayList<String>(), TypeToken.STRING);
 convertRaw(new ArrayList<Map<java.util.Date, Set<Thread>>>>(), TypeToken.STRING);
will attempt to use the same converter.

Parameters:
from - the object to convert.
toType - the type of the converted object.
Returns:
an instance of toType.
Throws:
NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException - if no converters for from's type to toType were found.
TooManyConvertersFoundException - if more than one converter for from's type to toType was found.
IllegalArgumentException - if from or toType is null (or void for toType).
BindingInvocationException - if there was an error during the converter's invocation.

convertRaw

protected Object convertRaw(Object from,
                            TypeToken<?> fromType,
                            TypeToken<?> toType)
                     throws NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException,
                            TooManyConvertersFoundException,
                            IllegalArgumentException,
                            BindingInvocationException
Performs a conversion, taking from (which is considered to be of type fromType for the purposes of this operation) and generating a new object of type toType. This method doesn't use generics for compile-time checking, returning the result as a raw Object.

Parameters:
from - the object to convert.
fromType - the type of the object to convert.
toType - the type of the converted object.
Returns:
an instance of toType.
Throws:
NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException - if no converters for fromType to toType were found.
TooManyConvertersFoundException - if more than one converter for fromType to toType was found.
IllegalArgumentException - if fromType or toType is null or void.
BindingInvocationException - if there was an error during the converter's invocation.

register

public void register(Object object)
              throws ConverterRegistrationException
Scans the given object for converter methods, registering them as bindings keyed by their types. Does nothing if the given object is null.

This method will iterate through all the given object's public methods and, for all methods marked with the Converts annotation, it will:

  • extract the converter type;
  • bind the method with the given object;
  • and check if there is no registered converter with the same type,
registering all the converters in one fell swoop if no problem is found. Non-public methods, even if marked with Converts, will be ignored.

Errors encountered during the process will be bundled together and thrown as a single exception. In that case, no converters will be registered, even if they're valid.

Parameters:
object - an object, hopefully with converter methods.
Throws:
ConverterRegistrationException - if there is some error during the operation.
See Also:
ConverterType.fromMethod(Method, Type), Binding.Binding(Object, Method), Transmuter.DependentConverterMap

unregister

public Binding unregister(ConverterType converterType)
Unregisters the converter for the given converter type. Does nothing if no such converter exists.

Parameters:
converterType - a converter type.
Returns:
the binding previously associated with the given converter type, or null if there was no such binding.

getConverterFor

protected Binding getConverterFor(ConverterType converterType)
                           throws NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException,
                                  TooManyConvertersFoundException
Attempts to return a converter compatible with the given converter type.

There can only be one exact match registered in the transmuter, which will be returned here; lacking that, a compatible converter will be looked for. An exception will be thrown if no converter is found, or if more than one compatible (non-exact match) converter is found, since this method cannot decide which should be returned.

Parameters:
converterType - a converter type.
Returns:
a converter compatible with the given converter type. May not an exact match.
Throws:
NoCompatibleConvertersFoundException - no compatible converters were found.
TooManyConvertersFoundException - more than one compatible converter was found.

getCompatibleConvertersFor

protected List<Binding> getCompatibleConvertersFor(ConverterType converterType)
Returns a list of all the compatible bindings found in this instance. Will be empty if the given converter type is null or has no compatible bindings.

Parameters:
converterType - a converter type.
Returns:
a list with all the compatible bindings found.

getConverterMap

protected Map<ConverterType,Binding> getConverterMap()
Returns a map holding all the registered converters, keyed by their converter types. This map is backed by this instance, i.e. changes made in this transmuter are seen in the map and vice-versa.

Returns:
a map holding all the registered converters, keyed by their converter types and backed by this instance.
